intro.title: What is a Self-Transfer Flight?
intro.lead: Discover how to travel smarter with more freedom.
body: A self-transfer flight is built from separate tickets, often across different airlines. Unlike a traditional layover, your flights aren’t linked — so you’ll check in separately, collect your luggage at stopovers, and may pass through customs or immigration depending on the country.

Why choose self-transfer? It unlocks more route options, gives you more control over your journey, and often means better prices. And with Mytrip’s Self-Transfer Guarantee, you’re covered if things don’t go as planned.
We’ll guide you through exactly what to expect, every step of the way.

notice: ⚠️ You may be transiting through the Schengen Area. A transit visa could be required.

cards.title: Check-In for Each Flight
cards.back: Each self-transfer flight needs its own check-in. Make sure to check in online for every airline before you travel.

cards.title: Visa Requirements
cards.back: Even if you don’t leave the airport, you may need a transit visa in some countries. Always check before you go.

cards.title: Pack Accordingly
cards.back: Cabin bag size and weight rules vary between airlines. Avoid surprises at the gate by checking in advance.

cards.title: Plan Enough Time
cards.front: Don’t cut your layover too short.
cards.back: For self-transfers, we recommend at least 90–120 minutes between flights to allow for baggage and security.

cards.title: Collect & Recheck Bags
cards.front: You’ll need to recheck them yourself.
cards.back: Even with the same airline, your bag won’t be transferred automatically. Pick it up and check it in again.

cards.title: Go Through Security Again
cards.back: You’ll exit and re-enter security at your connecting airport. Plan your time accordingly.

cards.title: Short Layover? Cabin Only
cards.front: Checked bags can cost you time.
cards.back: If your layover is under 2 hours, we strongly recommend cabin-only travel to avoid missed flights.

cards.title: Self-Transfer Guarantee
cards.back: The Self-Transfer Guarantee may not apply if your missed flight was due to short layovers or baggage delays.

faq.question: Do I have to collect and recheck my bags?
faq.answer: Yes, if you booked a self-transfer, your baggage won’t be moved automatically between flights. You’ll need to collect it and check it in again at your layover airport.

faq.question: Will I go through security again?
faq.answer: Usually, yes. You’ll likely exit and re-enter security, especially when changing terminals or airlines.

faq.question: What happens if I miss my flight?
faq.answer: Because each flight is a separate booking, missed connections are not automatically rebooked. But if your booking includes Mytrip's Self-Transfer Guarantee, you may be rebooked or refunded.

faq.question: Do I need a visa for my layover country?
faq.answer: Maybe. Even if you stay in the airport, some countries require a transit visa. Always check the rules for your layover country before flying.

faq.question: Can I check in for all flights at once?
faq.answer: No, each airline requires its own check-in. You’ll need to check in separately for every leg of your trip — online check-in is highly recommended.

faq.question: Can I travel with checked baggage?
faq.answer: You can, but it’s riskier. If your layover is short, there might not be enough time to collect and recheck your bags. Consider cabin bags only.

faq.question: What is the Self-Transfer Guarantee?
faq.answer: It’s protection from Mytrip that covers missed connections for eligible bookings. If a delay causes you to miss your next flight, we’ll help you get a new one or refund the unused leg.

guarantee.heading: You're Covered with Our Self-Transfer Guarantee
guarantee.lead: Book with confidence. If a delay causes you to miss your connection, we'll help get you back on track — at no extra cost.

items.title: Free Rebooking or Refund
items.description: We’ll rebook you for free or refund your trip if you're eligible and miss your next flight due to a delay.

items.title: Overnight Accommodation
items.description: If you're stuck overnight, we’ll help cover hotel costs so you can rest easy.

items.title: Meals and Refreshments
items.description: Get compensated for food and drinks during long layover delays (4+ hours).

items.title: Easy Eligibility
items.description: You just need to contact us before your missed flight departs. No lengthy forms or arguments.

guarantee.note: This coverage doesn’t apply to changes you make yourself, baggage issues due to your airline, or events outside our control (e.g. weather).
